result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Brehm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael James Brehm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael James Brehm was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at $7,433.50 payable to Suvrat T.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Pay all supervision fees.
with credit for 444 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment.  
Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Suvrat T.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of extended supervision.
Anger management; cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Brehm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (16 pages) commencing MAY 5, 2016, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, with credit for 444 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $7,433.50 payable to Suvrat T.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Suvrat T.
-Anger management; cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to file a motion for a new trial.  State and Defense request that the Court vacate the findings and conviction on COUNT 1.  Court GRANTS request, vacates the findings and conviction and grants judgment not withstanding the verdict and ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED.  Matter set for Sentencing on COUNT 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties in discussions regarding motion for a new trial and a resolution may have been reached.  Attorney requests additional time to speak with her client.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 676
cf
Scanned:  State Subpoena.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn via telephone, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney just appointed and is waiting for file to be delivered from prior counsel.  Attorney Cleghorn states that she will be filing motion papers and should be filed prior to the next Court date.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status of counsel conducted.   Public Defenders Office needs additional time to appoint counsel.  Matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  New counsel to be appointed by the public defenders office.  Matter adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing hearing. Both parties request an adjournment of today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Suvrat, T. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190803 in court 1x on 1/4/16.

At the hour of 1:39 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY on both counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for dismissal.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Defendant is REMANDED.
Jury Instructions and Exhibit List, filed
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Trial proceeded.  Jury in the box at 9:10 am.  Sworn for the state:  MPO Gary Post. Questions from the jury addressed by the court.  State rests.  Jury out of box at 9:37 am.  Court made a record of sidebars. Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case heard and denied by the court.  Defendant exercises his right to not testify.  Defendant advised of right to testify or not to testify.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Defense will not be presenting any witnesses.  Defense motion for dimissal at close of all the evidence heard and denied by the court.  Defense motion for consideration of lesser included crimes heard and denied by court.  Court reviews jury instructions with the state and defense.  Jury in box at 10:02 am.  Defense rests.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:52 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies  Vu Do and Jamie Arnold who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury question, filed.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:16  pm.  Court instructed jury panel during the jury selection.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause.  Jury out of box at 3:31 pm
Jury back in box at 3:48 pm.  Jurors were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Suvrat T.  Exhibit 1, 2, 3 & 4 offered and received.  Exhibits published to the jury.  Questions from the jury addressed by the court.   Jury recessed at 4: 53 pm and instructed to return the next day for continuation of the jury trial.  Court made a record of sidebar.   Filed:  questions from the jury.  Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called and parties are ready to proceed to jury trial.  Court addresses defendant regarding the issue of clothes for the defendant during the jury trial.   Court makes preliminary rulings prior to the start of the jury trial.  Court grants a sequestration order.  Case passed.  Case recalled.  Defendant has been provided with civilian clothing.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Parties are ready to proceed with the jury trial.  State placed its final offer on the record.
received and filed

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State placed its final offer on the record.  Defendant requests a new attorney.  Court denies the request.  Attorney Bohach remains as counsel.  Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 19.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion in limine, jury instructions and witness list to be filed by the final pretrial date.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case unable to proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Michael James Brehm not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for projected guilty plea.  Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Suvrat T. or the American Inn Motel at 6798 W Appleton Avenue

Defendant Michael James Brehm in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Michael James Brehm in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
